description: From Middle English skirmish (as a verb), from Old French escarmouche (“skirmish”), from Italian scaramuccia, earlier schermugio.

entries.meaning: (military) A brief battle between small groups, usually part of a longer or larger battle or war.

examples: Three people were arrested after a skirmish in a bar.

entries.meaning: A type of outdoor military style game using paintball or similar weapons.

verbs.description: skirmish (third-person singular simple present skirmishes, present participle skirmishing, simple past and past participle skirmished)

entries.meaning: To engage in a minor battle or dispute
